frame.name: FR_Commercial_transaction
frame.definition:
<def-root>These are words that describe basic commercial transactions involving a <fen>Buyer</fen> and a <fen>Seller</fen> who exchange <fen>Money</fen> and <fen>Goods</fen>. The individual words vary in the frame element realization patterns.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Commercial_transaction with FE modifications: the LUs in this frame do not syntactically mark which of the participants is the Seller and which is the Buyer, hence these FEs were replaced with Participant_1, Participant_2 and Participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Participant_1
FE.definition: <def-root>The participant in a commercial transaction that is encoded as the subject of an active-form sentence or as a by-PP in a passive. <ex><fex name="P1">L'amiral Miaoulis</fex> a forcé le blocus de Nelson pour <t>commercer</t> avec Marseille.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participant_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The participant in a commercial transaction that is coded in a with-PP <ex>L'amiral Miaoulis a forcé le blocus de Nelson pour <t>commercer</t> avec <fex name="P2">Marseille</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participants
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Participants</fen> are exchanging <fen>Money</fen> for <fen>Goods</fen>, the information about who originally had the <fen>Goods</fen> and the <fen>Money</fen> is not known.</def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.</def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. </def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>Price or payment per unit of Goods.</def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>The Unit of measure of the Goods according to which the exchange value of the Goods (or services) is set. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. </def-root>

frameRelation.type: Relation to FN1.5: Is Close to
